content: यज् {c1c} <ab>U.</ab> (यजति-ते, इयाज, ईजे; अयाक्षीत् अयष्ट, यक्ष्यति-ते, यष्टं, इष्ट; {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} इज्यते; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} यियक्षति-ते) {@--1@} To sacrifice, worship with sacrifices (often with <ab>instr.</ab> of words meaning ‘a sacrifice’); यजेत राजा क्रतुभिः <ls>Ms. 7. 79</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">5. 53</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">6. 36</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">11. 40</ls>; <ls>Bk. 14. 90</ls>; so अश्वमेधेनेजे, पाकयज्ञेनेजे &c. {@--2@} To make an oblation to (with <ab>acc.</ab> of the deity and <ab>instr.</ab> of the means of sacrifice or oblation); पशुना रुद्रं यजते <ls>Sk.</ls>; यस्तिलैर्यजतं पितॄन् <ls>Mb.</ls>, <ls>Ms. 8. 105</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">11. 119.</ls> {@--3@} To worship, adore, honour, revere. {@--4@} To consecrate, dedicate. {@--5@} To give, bestow. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (याजयति-ते) {@--1@} To cause to sacrifice. {@--2@} To assist at a sacrifice. {@--3@} To perform the office of the sacrificing priest.
